content:
What a great idea! Starting a new Instagram account focused on vegan recipes and cooking experiments can be a fantastic way to share your passion with like-minded individuals and build a community around your content.

Growing a new account from scratch requires effort, patience, and a solid strategy. Here are some tips to help you get started:

1. **Define your niche**: As you've already done, define your niche as vegan recipes and cooking experiments. This will help you attract a specific audience and create content that resonates with them.
2. **Create high-quality content**: Share high-quality, visually appealing photos and videos of your recipes, cooking experiments, and kitchen adventures. Invest in good camera equipment, and edit your photos to make them visually appealing.
3. **Develop a content strategy**: Plan your content in advance using a content calendar. Decide on the type of content you'll post, how often you'll post, and when you'll post. You can start with a mix of recipes, cooking tips, and behind-the-scenes content.
4. **Use relevant hashtags**: Research and use relevant hashtags in your captions, such as #veganrecipes, #plantbased, #cookingexperiments, and #veganfood. You can also create a branded hashtag for your account and encourage your followers to use it.
5. **Engage with your audience**: Respond to comments and messages promptly, ask for feedback, and encourage your followers to share their own vegan recipes and cooking experiences. This will help you build a loyal community around your account.
6. **Collaborate with other accounts**: Reach out to other vegan accounts, influencers, or bloggers and collaborate on content, shoutouts, or even a takeover. This can help you tap into their audience and grow your following.
7. **Run a giveaway or contest**: Host a giveaway or contest to encourage engagement and attract new followers. You can partner with a vegan brand or offer a cookbook or kitchen gadget as a prize.
8. **Utilize Instagram Stories and IGTV**: Share behind-the-scenes content, sneak peeks, and exclusive recipes on Instagram Stories and IGTV. These features can help increase engagement and attract new followers.
9. **Promote your account**: Share your Instagram content on other social media platforms, include a link to your Instagram account on your website or blog, and add a Instagram button to your email signature.
10. **Be consistent and patient**: Growing an account takes time and effort. Post regularly, engage with your audience, and be patient. Don't get discouraged by slow growth initially – it's normal.
11. **Analyze and adjust**: Use Instagram Insights to track your performance, and adjust your strategy based on your analytics. Experiment with different content types, hashtags, and posting schedules to see what works best for your account.
12. **Offer value**: Focus on providing value to your audience by sharing unique recipes, cooking tips, and kitchen hacks. This will keep your followers engaged and encourage them to share your content with others.

Additional tips:

* Post at least 3-5 times a week, but make sure you don't sacrifice quality for quantity.
* Use Instagram's features like polls, quizzes, and question stickers to engage with your audience.
* Share user-generated content (UGC) to encourage your followers to share their own vegan recipes and cooking experiences.
* Consider using Instagram's shopping feature to tag your favorite vegan products or cookbooks.

Remember, growing a successful Instagram account takes time, effort, and dedication. Focus on providing value to your audience, and with persistence and creativity, you can build a loyal following around your vegan recipes and cooking experiments account.
